name: Push-Up
description: A classic bodyweight exercise that targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps while engaging the core for stability.
instructions: Start in a plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor
Push through your palms to return to the starting position
Repeat for desired number of repetitions
setupInstructions: Ensure you have enough space around you
Remove any jewelry that might interfere
tips: Keep your core engaged throughout the movement
Don't let your hips sag or pike up
Control the descent - don't just drop down
Breathe in on the way down, out on the way up
commonMistakes: Not going through full range of motion

variations.name: Knee Push-Up
variations.description: Performed on knees instead of toes
instructions: Start in plank position on your knees
Keep body straight from knees to head
Perform push-up motion maintaining alignment

variations.name: Diamond Push-Up
variations.description: Hands form diamond shape, targets triceps more
instructions: Place hands close together forming diamond with thumbs and index fingers
Perform push-up keeping elbows close to body

name: Squat
description: A fundamental lower body exercise that targets the quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings while improving functional movement patterns.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out
Keep your chest up and core engaged
Lower your body by pushing your hips back and bending your knees
Descend until your thighs are parallel to the floor
Drive through your heels to return to starting position
setupInstructions: Find a flat surface with good footing
Consider having a chair behind you for reference
tips: Keep your knees in line with your toes
Don't let your knees cave inward
Keep your weight on your heels

variations.name: Chair-Assisted Squat
variations.description: Using chair for support and depth reference
instructions: Stand in front of chair
Lower until you lightly touch the chair
Stand back up without relying on chair

variations.name: Jump Squat
variations.description: Explosive squat with jump at the top
instructions: Perform regular squat
Explode up into a jump at the top
Land softly and immediately descend into next squat

name: Pull-Up
description: An upper body pulling exercise that primarily targets the latissimus dorsi, rhomboids, and biceps.
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar with palms facing away, hands shoulder-width apart
Engage your core and pull your body up
Continue until your chin clears the bar
Lower yourself with control to full arm extension
Repeat for desired repetitions
setupInstructions: Ensure pull-up bar is securely mounted
Check that you have clearance below
Consider using chalk for better grip if needed
tips: Focus on pulling with your back muscles, not just arms
commonMistakes: Not achieving full range of motion
Gripping too wide or too narrow

variations.name: Assisted Pull-Up
variations.description: Using resistance band or assistance for support
instructions: Place resistance band around bar and under knees or feet
Perform pull-up motion with band assistance
Focus on proper form and full range of motion

variations.name: Weighted Pull-Up
variations.description: Adding extra weight for increased difficulty
instructions: Attach weight belt or hold dumbbell between feet
Perform standard pull-up with added weight
Maintain strict form despite additional load
